titleInfo.title: CP5(FF) Irwin Village Site 12CP5, Campbell County, Tennessee. Mound 1. Feature 21, a rectangular structure approximately 250 ft. south of mound

mods.abstract: The east-west test trench south of the mound disclosed the post molds along the northeast corner of this structure. These were followed and the structure unearthed. The center hole is 2' deep and to the south lies a small fire pit rimmed with baked clay about 1/2" in thickness. At the probable doorway at the northeast corner were 2 flat limestone rocks. The molds averaged 4" in diameter all around without smaller molds on the corners. The average distance apart being three inches. A clay embankment extended along the west end approximately three-quarters of its length. This was 5" above the floor level at its highest point. (Note -- Storms at present time come down through the gap of mountains toward this same side of structure.)
mods.note: Observer illustration on file at the institution. See also photographs CP5(JJ) [fhm00510], 5-202 [fhm00551], 5-203 [fhm00552], 5-205 [fhm00554], 5-224 [fhm00561], 803CP5(G) [fhm00605], 824CP5 (K) [fhm00609], and 834CP5(O) [fhm00613].
